name: Dar Ayniwen Villa Hotel

reviews.title: Paradise on Earth
reviews.text: If you are looking for an exceptional calm holiday with your partner / family in a refined and beautiful place with paradise garden and birds, family-type of staff - helpful and discreet - all the amenities and more for comfort - look no further. Wherever you look - your see beauty ad style... Your senses will be stimulated, your spirit will regain its balance and quite simple you won't want to leave ... like us.

We stayed at Dar Ayniwen as a last-minute arrangement - we had planned to go to France instead, but I'm so glad we didn't. Despite it being the hottest time of the year to go, we thoroughly enjoyed our holiday.
reviews.title: Amazing place, great staff, couldn't fault a thing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are brilliant and the car service is very reliable. Arriving in Marrakech with two small children was a bit daunting but Stefan, Aziz and the team made sure our every wish was catered for, from making child-friendly meals, to washing the baby bottles and providing hot water or warm milk whenever we asked for it.
reviews.title: The Best Ever..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself really is an oasis. The suites are very comfortable, well air-conditioned and have everything you could want. DVD player came in handy for the kids!
reviews.title: Brilliant, photos speak for themselves, we totally reccommend Dar Ayniwen...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and garden are fantastic and well kept. The pool is cleaned every day and as the hotel is small, you are never sharing with more than a few people, if at all. Everyone who was staying there at the same time as us was lovely and our children made friends with the other kids quite easily. This made the stay even better for us all.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Oasis

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Marrakech with our best friends, who have been raving about Dar Ayniwen for the last few years. Really didn't know what to expect as we are used to the large hotel resorts in places like Dubai. However, we are quite reluctant to praise this magical place as we really want to keep it as our 'secret find'. This wouldn't be fair on Aziz and his wonderful staff, who really deserve a huge amount of praise. Our 5 night break turned into 14 nights due to the Icelandic volcanic ash cloud and we still didn't want to leave at the end of our extended trip. We felt the luckiest people on earth to have been stranded in a place like this and Aziz made what could have been a nightmare for us into a dream! It is the most relaxing place we have ever stayed in and absolutely love the contrast of the chaotic souks to the peace of the hotel. All staff work so hard to make you feel so welcome and at home. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! We shall definitely be returning!!!
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.text: Just far enough out of Marrakech and lovely and peaceful after the din of the Medina.Breakfasts wonderful with great local pancakes and crumpets,restaurant dinner also very good,although food and drinks prices quite high.
reviews.title: Great Hotel......Great Find!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kids loved the pool and the safe enviroment within the walls of the hotel.
reviews.title: Paradise in Marrakesh

reviews.text: The hotel is a real treat,with great service coming from Aziz and his waiters,waitress',drivers and maids.Thanks very much.
reviews.title: Wouldn't hesitate to recommend

reviews.text: We had the most wonderful stay at this incredibly peaceful and welcoming Riad. Aziz and his colleagues could not have been more welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. From breakfast by the pool every morning listening to the wonderful bird song to candle lit dinners at night. Aziz stressed that this was our home whilst we were there and he meant it....it was just so relaxing and peaceful. Being about fifteen minutes from Marrakesh meant complete calm whilst at Dar Ayniwen but the complementary cars made journeys out easy and stress free. A wonderful experience and one we will repeat. Thank you Aziz for your wonderful hospitality.
reviews.title: A very relaxing hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: Arriving gone midnight at Marrakech airport we were greeted with the friendly face of one of the hotel's drivers who whisked us away to this fabulous hotel. We were greeted with Moroccan mint tea and petits-fours before being taken upstairs to our amazing suite. The room overlooked the garden and swimming pool and had a private terrace that could easily fit 10 people for dinner. From there it just got better and better, with a level of service that was not only consistent but so warm and professional. Spa treatments are divine, the food freshly brought from the morning's market and the cocktails simply help you become even more relaxed!!! The owner is charm personified and the house contained an amazing eclectic collection of antiques that I would have gladly taken home. DO go to this place as it will be an experience of a lifetime and will make you want to go back time and time again!
reviews.title: Ssshhh don't tell anyone about this hidden gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a fantastic week here, everything was perfect from the ultra freindly staff who couldn't do too for you to the lovely Moroccan food. The peace and quiet of the gardens after the hustle and bustle of the city was wonderful. Even thought it is situated a good 15 minutes from the centre, an air conditioned mini bus, which will drop you off and pick you up on request, is included in the cost. Fancy visitng one of the sites, eating out somewhere different or dancing the night away, the host, who lives on site and is always around, is full of ideas and information which were all spot on. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: An Oasis of pleasure
a wonderful retreat....
reviews.text: beautiful, peaceful and quiet, a fantastic base for exploring the city.....we saw the suites of two other guests and although we thought the Galaxie suite which we had was amazing, we thought that all the suites were very impressive....well kept grounds and pool and the staff were discreet but very helpful whenever we needed them.....

By far the best hotel we have stayed at. Aziz and team were brilliant and made us feel very welcome! A beautiful place and we loved it. Dar Ayniwen cannot possibly be faulted. We will defintely come back again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Dar Aynwien is like living an exotic poem. I generally have little time for words such as ‘healing’ or ‘magical’ but they do apply to this unique oasis. The sheer beauty and care of the grounds, the richness and uniqueness of the rooms and buildings, the warmth and dignity of the staff, the kindness of our host Stephane and his wife and an excellent kitchen all came together to provide a most singular holiday experience. My wife and I spent a week at Dar Anywien and even on the last day we were still saying ‘Wow’.
reviews.title: Staying within an exotic poem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With only eight suites, each with its own character and charm, Dar Ayniwen is a true gem in the Palmeraie. My husband and I had a relaxing and romantic stay, enjoying the setting, food and superb service. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful, helping arrange guides, restaurant reservations, camel rides and more. Here we had our best service during our travels in Morocco. The landscape, gardens, courtyards and pool provide an exquisite setting. Free transfer service at any time of day (or night) was an invaluable amenity, making travel to and from the airport and Marrakesh hassle free. Definitely don't miss this place!
reviews.title: A dream of a stay -beautiful setting, great service and luxurious accomodation

reviews.text: After doing a lot of research searching for a place to stay in Palmerie I chose this lovely looking elegant Riad for a trip with my teenage daughter. We wanted a pool and garden and someplace with character. We found all three at the very special world you enter when you come to Dar Ayniwen. It' sone of the oldest mansions in the area and has a wonderfull mellow, aristocratic yet unpretentious air about it. The charming and modest host/owner is hands-on and observant, and manages his delightful staff beautifully. The whole place ran so smoothly it was a delight. We were generously upgraded to a bigger suite so we wouldnt have to share a Kingsized bed. The suite had its own private garden and gorgeous marble bathroom.
reviews.title: Blissful retreat

reviews.text: There is wonderful original art and antiques throughout the property, with all sorts of places to read, relax and wander about. The huge pool is deep and cool, perfect for swimming after lazing in the sun. The staff are adorable. Zak looked after us and could not have been more attentive and untuively thoughtful. The Manager Aziz was totally organised and made everything so easy. Everyone was friendly and fun to talk with--there was no stuffiness at all. The hotel has a generous attitude...they even provide a car to take you into town and pick you up. When my daughter felt unwell in the heat I rang the hotel to see if they could pick us up and they came immediately and were so kind to her--offering to make special tummy friendly toast and boiled rice...it was much appreciated. However their own food is too good to pass up--all freshly made to order from local ingredients.
reviews.title: Wonderful - again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also an in-house beauty and massage therapist and a lovely private Hammam.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dar Ayniwen is the sort of place that you could dream away the days in complete happiness. I would happily return.
reviews.title: Total Bliss

description: Dar Ayniwen Villa Hotel is a sanctuary of peace and tranquillity. Built as the owner's family home, in the Oriental-Andalusian style in a 5 acres park, 20 years ago, this majestic old residence with its charming and peaceful garden stands in front of the Atlas Mountains. This seven suites Villa was turn into a luxury guesthouse in 2000, all of the very highest quality, and is now run by father and son.
